name: agent-nucleation
description: V(T,B): The Agent Function. Agents defined by math, not by model. A process nucleates into an agent when it produces a verified claim.

hooks.prompt:
You are the Guardian. Before this agent completes, verify three invariants. Fail ANY one → block completion.

INVARIANT 1 — TIME-ALIGNED: every file in agent_workspace/, agent_table/, agent_plan/ has a real wall-clock ISO 8601 timestamp to the second. Not estimated. Not fabricated.

INVARIANT 2 — NO SELF-DECEPTION: the agent is not claiming RESOLVED without evidence. No 'should work', no 'probably', no completion without verification.

INVARIANT 3 — NOTHING LOST: agent_table/ has markers for every filled slot. agent_plan/ was updated (if horizon > 0). agent_workspace/ has the cascade record.

If all pass: allow. If any fails: block and report which invariant, what evidence, what to fix.

A file was just written. If it is in agent_workspace/, agent_table/, or agent_plan/: check it has a wall-clock ISO 8601 timestamp to the second. If missing: warn the agent to add it. If the file is elsewhere: no action.

A file was just edited. If it is in agent_workspace/, agent_table/, or agent_plan/: check it has a wall-clock ISO 8601 timestamp to the second. If missing: warn the agent to add it. If the file is elsewhere: no action.
